title: 110_s454
content: The Act titled "Improving Access to Higher Education Act of 2007" increases Federal Pell Grants. The Higher Education Act of 1965 is amended to increase Federal Pell Grants for the academic year 2007-2008. The amendment includes changes to the expected family contribution and the grant amount. Additionally, there are additional funds authorized and appropriated for this purpose. The Higher Education Act of 1965 is amended to increase Federal Pell Grants for the academic year 2007-2008 by raising the maximum grant amount to $500. An additional $4,331,000,000 is authorized and appropriated for this purpose. The Higher Education Act of 1965 is amended to increase Federal Pell Grants for the academic year 2007-2008 by $1,050, with an additional $4,331,000,000 allocated for this purpose. The amendments will take effect on July 1, 2007. Expansion of deduction for interest on education loans. Increased Limitation on Education Loan Interest Deduction: The maximum deduction for the taxable year is now $3,750, with an increase in phaseout to $75,000 ($150,000). Conforming amendments have been made to adjust the amounts accordingly. The amendment increases the $75,000 and $150,000 amounts for education loan interest deduction for taxable years after 2007. The adjustment is based on the cost-of-living adjustment determined for the calendar year in which the taxable year begins. The effective date for these changes is after December 31, 2006. The amendments made by this section apply to taxable years beginning after December 31, 2006. Title IX of the Economic Growth and Tax Relief Reconciliation Act of 2001, regarding the sunset of provisions, does not apply to the elimination of the 60-month limit and increase in income limitation on student loan interest deduction. SEC. 4. COVERDELL EDUCATION SAVINGS ACCOUNTS. Increase in allowable contributions for Coverdell Education Savings Accounts from $2,000 to $3,000. Reports must be filed by June 30 of the following year. Effective date is for taxable years beginning after December 31, 2006. Repeal of sunset provision for certain tax relief act. The amendments made by this section apply to taxable years starting after December 31, 2006. The sunset provision in the Economic Growth and Tax Relief Reconciliation Act of 2001 does not apply to modifications to education individual retirement accounts. Section 5 repeals the sunset provision for employer-provided educational assistance under the Economic Growth and Tax Relief Reconciliation Act of 2001.
